scalar_parameters._psi2: Gives same fractional damage as DICE for delta_T=1.941 and y_net = 23239 (2050 values in DICE baseline) assuminng 10k$
scalar_parameters._k_climate: From DICE central case emissions and temperature change 2020 to 2050; Temperature sensitivity to cumulative  (K/tCO2) 0.5e-12 ~ 1.8 K per 1000 GtC [noe we are in CO2 units]
scalar_parameters._rho: Pure rate of time preference (1 % per year)
scalar_parameters._fract_gdp: Fraction of GDP available for redistribution and abatement
scalar_parameters._mu_max: Maximum allowed abatement fraction (cap on μ). Values >1 allow carbon removal.
scalar_parameters._Ecum_initial: Initial cumulative CO2 emissions (tCO2). Set to 0 for no prior emissions. 1.24715/k_climate to match 2020 Barrage & Nordhaus 2023.
scalar_parameters._K_initial: Initial capital stock ($). Represents total productive capital at start of simulation.
scalar_parameters._y_net_reference: Reference net income level ($) for income-dependent damage calculation. Typically set to current global average net income.
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_damage_distribution: If true, damage weighted towards low-income (uses y_damage_distribution_exponent and y_net_reference)
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_aggregate_damage: Subswitch of income_dependent_damage_distribution: If false, aggregate damage is fixed and distribution adjusted to match; if true, aggregate damage decreases as world gets richer
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_tax_policy: If true, progressive tax (tax richest); if false, uniform fractional tax
scalar_parameters._income_redistribution: If true, enable redistribution; if false, no redistribution (all revenues to abatement)
scalar_parameters._income_dependent_redistribution_policy: Subswitch of income_redistribution. If true, targeted to lowest income; if false, uniform dividend

A._initial_value: DICE is 5.84 with capital stock in trillions; pop in millions
A._final_value: DICE is 38743.985 with capital stock in trillions; pop in millions
A._adjustment_coefficient: analytic representation of Barrage and Nordhaus 2023 TFP projection

L._adjustment_coefficient: analytic representation of Barrage and Nordhaus 2023 population projection

sigma._initial_value: tons CO2 per $, from kg per $ in Barage & Nordhaus 2023
sigma._final_value: tons CO2 per $, from kgCO2 per $ in Barage & Nordhaus 2023
sigma._adjustment_coefficient: analytic representation of Barrage and Nordhaus 2023 carbon intensity projection

theta1._description: Abatement cost per ton of CO2 for the last ton abated ($/tCO2)
theta1._initial_value: Best 2 double exponential fit to Barage & Nordhaus 2023
theta1._growth_rate_1: 2-exponential fit to sigma in Barrage & Nordhaus 2023
theta1._growth_rate_2: 2-exponential fit to sigma in Barrage & Nordhaus 2023
theta1._fract_1: 2-exponential fit to sigma in Barrage & Nordhaus 2023

Gini_background._description: Background Gini index (restoring attractor for Gini dynamics), assuming t = 0 is year 2020
Gini_background._exponential_scaling: Exponential scaling to represent projected Gini changes over time from SSP2, https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/acbdb0
Gini_background._additive_constant: Additive constant to represent projected Gini changes over time from SSP2, https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/acbdb0
Gini_background._growth_rate: Growth rate to represent projected Gini changes over time from SSP2, https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1748-9326/acbdb0

integration_parameters._plot_short_horizon: Time horizon (years) for short-term detailed plots. Creates second PDF book with results from t_start to this time.

optimization_parameters._description: ITERATIVE REFINEMENT MODE: optimization_iterations is integer (number of iterations), initial_guess is scalar
optimization_parameters._max_evaluations: Maximum number of objective function evaluations PER ITERATION
optimization_parameters._optimization_iterations: INTEGER: Number of refinement iterations. Final iteration will have n_points_final_f control points if specified.
optimization_parameters._optimize_time_points: should we run an additional optimization at the end to jiggle time points?
optimization_parameters._chebyshev_scaling_power: Power for Chebyshev node transformation (>1 concentrates points near start, <1 near end, =1 standard). Default 1.5 concentrates points in early years.
optimization_parameters._n_points_initial_f: number of f control points in first iteration. Refinement base = (n_points_final_f - 1)^(1/(n_iterations - 1)). Omit to use default base=2.0
optimization_parameters._n_points_final_f: number of f control points in final iteration. Refinement base = (n_points_final_f - 1)^(1/(n_iterations - 1)). Omit to use default base=2.0
optimization_parameters._initial_guess_f: SCALAR: Initial f value for both t_start and t_end in first iteration. Subsequent iterations use PCHIP interpolation from previous solution
optimization_parameters._bounds_f: Bounds for f (abatement fraction) as [min, max]. Default: [0.0, 1.0]
optimization_parameters._initial_guess_s: SCALAR: Initial s value for both t_start and t_end in first iteration. Presence of this field enables dual optimization of both f and s.
optimization_parameters._bounds_s: Bounds for s (savings rate) as [min, max]. Default: [0.0, 1.0]. Example: [0.2, 0.3] constrains savings between 20-30%
optimization_parameters._n_points_final_s: number of s control points in final iteration. Can differ from n_points_final_f to allow different temporal resolution for each variable.
optimization_parameters._algorithm_note: Optional: specify NLopt algorithm. Omit to use default (LN_SBPLX). Local algorithms recommended for iterative refinement.
optimization_parameters._algorithm: LN_SBPLX (local derivative-free Subplex, default, robust for noisy objectives)
optimization_parameters._stopping_criteria: NLopt stopping criteria. For f,s ∈ [0,1], absolute tolerance makes more sense than relative.
optimization_parameters._xtol_abs: Absolute tolerance on control parameters (f,s values): stops when all |Δf|,|Δs| < 1e-10. Appropriate since f,s ∈ [0,1].
